abstract.p: British concern Gallaher Group will buy Russian cigarette maker Liggett-Ducat for $390.5 million; deal gives Gallaher biggest share of market where estimated 260 billion cigarettes were smoked last year (S)

block.p: Expanding into a market with a population of heavy smokers, the British concern Gallaher Group will buy the Russian cigarette maker Liggett-Ducat for $390.5 million. The deal gives Gallaher the biggest share of a market where an estimated 260 billion cigarettes were smoked last year. Gallaher will acquire the company, with assets including a new factory in Moscow and distribution operations from the Vector Group of the United States. Liggett-Ducat, which had sales of $92.5 million last year, is Russia's biggest seller, with 50 percent of the market for cheap cigarettes and 17 percent of the market over all.
